Chase Vriezema - Software Developer - Game Designer -

Portfolio

About

I am a Software Developer currently living in Rowlett, Texas. I have a passion for both design and programming, and I am well-rounded in both fields.

Being able to learn and grow in the cornerstone if any good developer. I strive to learn with each new project I work on, and apply those lessons to my work moving forwards.

Download Resume

Around the Web

Copyright © Chase Vriezema 2023

Coinsplash

Coinsplash is a slots based business management game that I worked on for a year during its softlaunch lifetime. I was on a team of two other people, and contributed majorly to many of the features and fixes we implemented in the game. I helped build its analytics system, ad management system, IAP system and many different gameplay features while I was there. I also spearheaded many efforts to improve the maintainability and extensability of our codebase, as well as handle many of our optimization challenges such as speeding up loadtimes and handling latency on network calls.

  • Client: Mogul Games Inc.
  • Date: Fall 2022
  • Tools: Unity
Playstore

Wordscapes search

Wordscapes Search is a mobile game for iOS and Android based around simple Wordsearch Gameplay. I worked on the project from it's beta stages to supporting it with post launch content and contributed to most of it's features during that time. I was able to spearhead development on certain features such as introducing various gamemodes, its collectable items system and its timed events. I worked on a team that ranged from 5 people at its smallest to around 15 people at its largest, and contributed to sprint planning and maintaining the codebase.

  • Client: PeopleFun
  • Date: Summer 2021
  • Tools: Unity, Jira, DeltaDNA, Jenkins, C#, Github
Appstore

Blockscapes

Blockscapes is a mobile game created by PeopleFun where you arrange blocks within a grid to fill rows and cause the blocks to disappear. This was one of the projects in our 'core swap' program at the time where we took common features from multiple games (menus, IAP framework and ad systems) and swapped the core gameplay to rapidly prototype ideas. My contributions on this project mainly revolve around the shop screen which was redone from the ground up to integrate AB testing into our IAPs and as well as make use of new Unity UI features.

  • Client: PeopleFun
  • Date: Summer 2020
  • Tools: Unity, Jira, DeltaDNA, Jenkins, C#, Github
Appstore

Fate

Fate is a digital collectable card game that uniquely mixes multiple genres into one. It won the UTD Best Capstone 2018 Award. I spent a little less than two years designing Fate and I decided to create a full vertical slice of gameplay for my Arts and Technology capstone project. The prototype was made over the course of one semester, and I implemeneted every feature from the physical version of the game.

  • Client: UTD Capstone
  • Date: Fall 2018
  • Tools: Unity
Go to download

Mirts

Mildly Interesting RTS is an iOS game that has reached top ten on the App Store. I designed, implemented, and tested many features for the game, most of which have made it into the released version of the game. Since then I have also returned to iterate and improve on previous features in the game.

  • Date: Spring 2018
  • Tools: Rubymotion
Go to App Store

Panopticon

Panopticon is a 2D Platformer made by the graduate level game lab program at UTD. I primarily worked as an engineer on the project, and was responsible for player input, character mechanics, and the animation controller for the character. These tasks required heavy collaboration with our level designer, game designer, and our animator. In total the team was about twelve people and the project was done over the course of a single semester.

  • Client: UTD Game Lab
  • Date: Spring 2017
  • Tools: Unity, C#, Maya,
